channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A mite-y use of electricity
item.description: Mites who hitchhike on the beaks of hummingbirds use a surprising method to help them on their journey: electricity. These hummingbird flower mites fe...

item.title: How simple prompts can make partially automated cars safer
item.description: A new study finds that prompts do a good job of getting drivers to engage with their environment and take over control of the vehicle when necessary w...

item.title: Innovative one-minute video game boasts 80% success rate in diagnosing autism
item.description: A new one-minute video game is able to accurately and efficiently identify children with autism from those who have ADHD or are neurotypical.

item.title: Follow the water: Searching for a lunar oasis
item.description: As humankind imagines living off-planet -- on the moon, Mars and beyond -- the question of how to sustain life revolves around the physical necessitie...

item.title: Ocean-surface warming four times faster now than late-1980s
item.description: The study helps explain why 2023 and early 2024 saw unprecedented ocean temperatures.
